intro: Oligosporus songaricus, commonly known as the Songaric spore plant, is a rare species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, adapting to its high-altitude environment. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research.
